abstract: Australian Prime Min Tony Abbott’s objection to same-sex marriage causes discontentment among his Liberal Party membership, including Christine Forster, Abbott’s gay sister who is on Sydney City Council; objection is latest disparagement of Abbott’s leadership and incites opposition, Labor Party, to pledge passage of bill if returned to power.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Tony Abbott has staked out an uncompromising stance against same-sex nuptials, pitting him against his sister, who is gay.

headline.main: Australian Leader, Opposing Gay Marriage, Faces Party and Family Opposition
headline.print_headline: Australian Ruling Party Split Over Legalizing Gay Marriage

snippet: Prime Minister Tony Abbott has staked out an uncompromising stance against same-sex nuptials, pitting him against his sister, who is gay.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
